intro: Dicellandra barteri, commonly known as the Barter's dicellandra, is a rare and unique plant species native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf morphology. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
